description: Borrowed from Latin corpus (“body”). Doublet of corpse, corps, and riff.

nouns.description: corpus (plural corpora or corpuses or corpusses or (proscribed) corpi)

entries.meaning: A collection of writings, often on a specific topic, of a specific genre, from a specific demographic or a particular author, etc.
examples: Synonyms: collection, compilation, aggregation; see also Thesaurus:body

entries.meaning: (specifically, linguistics) Such a collection in form of an electronic database used for linguistic analyses.
